intro: Hypolytrum pungens, commonly known as the sharp-leaved lily, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Iridaceae and is characterized by its striking, sword-shaped leaves and tall, erect flowering stems. The plant produces showy, clustered flowers in shades of yellow and orange, which bloom during the warmer months. Hypolytrum pungens is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and is adapted to grow in well-drained soils. It is also noted for its ability to thrive in full sun to partial shade conditions.
